mxCell.value: Nice to meet you!

<<Accounts>>

Welcome [[user_first_name]] to MyBudgetCoach! MyBudgetCoach is a unique budgeting software that comes along with a virtual avatar. You selected, me, Nick Smith, as your personal coach. I look forward to helping you start a new phase of your journey to financial wellness!

<<Accounts>>

Before we begin the set-up process, I just want to let you know about some aspects of MyBudgetCoach.

<<Accounts>>

As your virtual coach, I will be available whenever you are. You can complete set-up steps all at once, or you can complete them over time. Please move at your pace, and whenever you are ready for the next step of our work together, I will be here to help you out.

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for your response!

We will start off with the following steps for the Account Set-Up stage. 
  1. Renaming Budget
  2. Adding Accounts
  3. Overview of Account screen
  4. Adding a transaction
  5. Verifying Starting Balance

<<Accounts>>

This Account Set-Up stage takes 10-15 minutes on average. Let's get started!
Thanks for the insight!
Ask Away

<<Accounts>>

To personalize your experience setting up MyBudgetCoach, I will ask you questions along the way. These questions will shift my coaching approach so I am helping you the best way for your specific goals.

My current budgeting system isn't bringing me closer to my financial wellness goals
sign_up_reason = not_closer

I haven't created a routine budget process and am looking to get started
sign_up_reason = new_budget

<<Accounts>>

What brought you to sign up for MyBudgetCoach?
I will keep that in mind

<<Accounts>>

You can set-up multiple budgets in your MyBudgetCoach account. An example for when a new budget can be helpful is when you have a big life event, such as a change in job, and want to start 'fresh' with your new financial reality.
I renamed my Budget

<<Accounts>>

MyBudgetCoach allows you to name each budget. I recommend to name the Budget something specific, and end with "..._MonthYear" that you start the budget. This will help you remember which Budget was used for which time period.

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for your response!

Let's start adding accounts!

<<Accounts>>

Before we start adding accounts, please answer two questions so I can tailor my guidance to your financial infrastructure.

It's just me!
budget_with_partner = just_me

Yes and we have consolidated finances and expenses are paid out of joint accounts.
budget_with_partner = joint_consolidated

Yes and we have separate financial households. I'm just going to set up my part of the financial household.
budget_with_partner = joint_separate

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for your response. Just one more question.

Do you budget with a partner?
Got it, just one account

<<Accounts>>

Based on your answers, I recommend adding just your checking account.

Since you don't have any other accounts where expenses are paid out of, one account is enough!

<<Accounts>>

Based on your answers, I recommend adding your checking account first and then your main credit card account.

<<Accounts>>

Based on your answers, I recommend adding just your joint checking account.

Since you don't have any other accounts where expenses are paid out of, one account is enough!

<<Accounts>>

Based on your answers, I recommend adding your checking account first and then your main credit card account.

<<Accounts>>

Based on your answers, I recommend adding your joint checking account first and then your main joint credit card account.

I use my credit card for day-to-day spending and my bank account for routine bills
account_structure = 1_and_1
3 or more

<<Accounts>>

You answered earlier that you have more than one credit card. Let me ask a question to understand more about your current financial structure.
Ask Away
Ok; One more account

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for your answer! Let's add one more account to capture your total expenses.
Hmm...Let me think which one - OK; I have decided

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for your answer! Let's now add the credit card account that is used the most often of your remaining accounts.

<<Accounts>>

How many transactions per week occur on your remaining credit card account?
Oh right, understood

<<Accounts>>

Congratulations on adding three accounts! As you continue to use MyBudgetCoach, please keep in mind each account requires reconciliation, a few times a week, and categorizing of transactions.
5 or Less transactions
account_structure = more_than_one_cc AND (budget_with_partner = just_me OR budget_with_partner = joint_separate)

<<Accounts>>

Based on the number of transactions that occur per week, I would recommend leaving out the additional account for now, and then if you would like to add it on a future date, feel free!

<<Accounts>>

Based on the number of transactions that occur per week, let's add one more account so your expenses can be accurately captured each month.
More than 5 transactions

<<Accounts>>

To summarize, you have now added a total of four accounts.
Hmm...Let me think which one - OK; I have decided

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for your answer! Let's now add the credit card account that is used the most often of your remaining accounts.

<<Accounts>>

How many transactions per week occur on your next most highly used credit card of your remaining accounts?
Oh right, understood

<<Accounts>>

Congratulations on adding three accounts! As you continue to use MyBudgetCoach, please keep in mind each account requires reconciliation, a few times a week, and categorizing of transactions.
5 or Less transactions
account_structure = more_than_one_cc AND (budget_with_partner = just_me OR budget_with_partner = joint_separate)

<<Accounts>>

Based on the number of transactions that occur per week, I would recommend leaving out the remainder of your credit card accounts for now, and then if you would like to add additional ones on a future date, feel free!
Ok; I do want to capture all my expenses

<<Accounts>>

Based on the number of transactions that occur per week, let's add the next most used credit card account so your expenses can be accurately captured each month.
More than 5 transactions

<<Accounts>>

How many transactions per week occur on your next most highly used credit card of your remaining accounts?

<<Accounts>>

To summarize, you have now added a total of four accounts. Prior to linking a fifth account, I am going to ask you the same question as before, for the frequency of transactions.
5 or less transactions
account_structure = more_than_one_cc AND (budget_with_partner = just_me OR budget_with_partner = joint_separate)

<<Accounts>>

Based on the number of transactions that occur per week, I would recommend leaving out the additional account for now, and then if you would like to add it on a future date, feel free!
account_structure = more_than_one_cc AND (budget_with_partner = just_me OR budget_with_partner = joint_separate)
account_structure = more_than_one_cc AND budget_with_partner = joint_consolidated

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for your response. I understand you have many accounts that you use routinely. To ensure we don't over complicate your account structure, let's hold off adding any additional accounts for now. If later on in your MyBudgetCoach use you determine additional accounts should be added to capture all your expense transactions, feel free to add additional accounts!
More than 5 transactions
I am making progress!

<<Accounts>>

So far, you have completed steps 1 and 2 of the Account Set-Up stage.  
  1. Renaming Budget
  2. Adding Accounts
  3. Overview of Account screen
  4. Adding a transaction
  5. Verifying Starting Balance
We will now work through the features of the Account screen.
I have selected my checking account

<<Accounts>>

Please select your checking account.

<<Accounts>>

Starting at the top of the screen, the account name is at the top. This can be a helpful reminder if you aren't sure which account you are working in.
This seems rare; good to know when it comes up!

<<Accounts>>

The arrows to the right of the Search Bar are an option to condense or expand 'split transactions'. Split transactions are when you have a single transaction split between multiple categories.
Hope this won't happen often!

<<Accounts>>

We are going to walk through a series of steps to validate your starting balance for the checking account you added prior.

<<Accounts>>

To verify your understanding of the account screen, I will now walk you through adding two test transactions to the checking account.
I have selected my checking account

<<Accounts>>

Please select your checking account.

<<Accounts>>

Please select the '+ Add New' option under the account balance to add a new transaction.
I added the payee

<<Accounts>>

For the Payee, let's enter 'Grocery Store.' Since this is a new Payee, select + Create Payee.

<<Accounts>>

For the Notes, let's leave blank for now.
I selected Food for the category

<<Accounts>>

For the Category, select 'Food'. You can type 'F' and watch the available categories filter down accordingly.

<<Accounts>>

Let's assume an outflow of 50 for groceries.

<<Accounts>>

KNOWLEDGE CHECK

Should the 50 be entered
in the 'Payment' or 
'Deposit' column?
I added 50 in the payment column

<<Accounts>>

Correct! Since this is an outflow for the checking account, this purchase is entered into the Payment column. Let's do that now.

<<Accounts>>

Actually, this transaction is entered as a Payment. A Deposit is income coming into your checking account. For example, your paycheck would be a Deposit. Any outflow for purchases or paying bills would be entered as Payment. Let's do that now.
I added my first transaction!

<<Accounts>>

To add the transaction, select the 'Add' button.

<<Accounts>>

Notice that when you add a new transaction, the system defaults the checkmark symbol to a non-filled color which means the transaction is not yet cleared.

<<Accounts>>

For this example, the transaction 
happened earlier in the day, so please select the checkmark to turn it green and 'Clear' the transaction.
I added my paycheck!

<<Accounts>>

Let's now add a transaction for an inflow. For the Payee enter 'Employer,' select a Category of Income, enter 500 in the Deposit field, and select 'Add.'
I see that

<<Accounts>>

Now that you have added two transactions, please take note that the payment to the grocery store has been cleared, but the income has not been cleared.
Ok; I am looking at the two numbers

<<Accounts>>

Please select the Account Balance to view the Cleared and Uncleared total.
I see; an inverse relationship since the balance is negative!

<<Accounts>>

The important difference between the
two types of accounts is that in a credit card account, Payments increase the balance, and Deposits decrease the balance. This is because a credit card balance is negative.
I have selected my credit card account.

<<Accounts>>

Please select your main credit card account to add two hypothetical transactions.
Ok; I am logged in

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank now so you can gather your current balance of your checking account.
Ok; I am logged in to my credit card account

<<Accounts>>

Let's now add your credit card account. 

Please login to your bank so you can gather your current credit card balance.
I have added my credit card account

<<Accounts>>

Please select + Add account and then Create Local Account. Name your account, and then enter the current balance of your credit card.

NOTE: Since a credit card balance represents debt, when you enter the balance, add a leading '-' to make the amount entered negative.
Ok; Works for me!

<<Accounts>>

Although you may have a savings account, as you first start using MyBudgetCoach, I recommend to not link the Savings account at this stage.
Heck yes I do!!!

<<Accounts>>

You are all done adding accounts. Do you feel the momentum building towards achieving your goals!?
Not so fast...

<<Accounts>>

Great job adding your  account! You may be thinking: Let me add in a savings account next.

<<Accounts>>

If you want to further understand how to easily use saving accounts in MyBudgetCoach, please schedule a one-on-one coaching session with me.
account_structure = more_than_one_cc AND (budget_with_partner = just_me OR budget_with_partner = joint_separate)
Ok; I am logged in

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank now so you can gather your current balance of your joint checking account.
Ok; I am logged in

<<Accounts>>

Let's now add your joint credit card account. 

Please login to your bank so you can gather your current credit card balance.

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank now so you can gather your current balance of your joint checking account.

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank now so you can gather your current balance of your checking account.
I have added my checking account
Ok; I am logged in
Ok; I am logged in

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank now so you can gather your current balance of your checking account.
Ok; I am logged in to my main credit card account

<<Accounts>>

Let's now add your credit card account. Please add the most used account first.

Please login to your bank so you can gather your current credit card balance.
Ok; I am logged in to my 2nd credit card account

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank so you can gather your current credit card balance.
Ok; I am logged in to my 2nd credit card account

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank so you can gather your current credit card balance.

<<Accounts>>

Before we link a fourth account, let me ask a follow-up question.
Good idea; Four accounts is alot to manage
Ok; I am logged in

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank so you can gather your current credit card balance.
Last account, I am so close!
Ok; I am logged in to my 2nd most used credit card account

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank so you can gather your current credit card balance.

<<Accounts>>

Before we link a fourth account, let me ask a follow-up question.
Good idea; Four accounts is alot to manage
Ok; I am logged in to my 3rd most used credit card account

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank so you can gather your current credit card balance.

<<Accounts>>

Please note that linking many accounts leads to a complicated use of MyBudgetCoach and could lead to feeling overwhelmed each time you log in.
I want to avoid feeling overwhelmed...

<<Accounts>>

Under the account name is the balance of the account you are viewing. 

You can select the balance, and that expands more details with an amount for uncleared and cleared totals.
Tell me more...

<<Accounts>>

Under the balance is a series of options which makes changes to the transactions table.
That's helpful!

<<Accounts>>

Import: This option allows you to upload an excel or csv file of a download of transactions from your bank online account.
I could see using this often

<<Accounts>>

Add New: Select this when you want to manually add a transaction.
Nice feature!

<<Accounts>>

Filter: This allows you to view transactions based on certain requirements. Please select Filter and review the various fields available.
Oh good, a robust search!

<<Accounts>>

Shifting focus now to the right side of the screen, there is the Search Bar. As you start typing, the system dynamically filters down the transactions based on payee, category, or transaction amounts based on the text entered.
Tell me more...

<<Accounts>>

To the right of that are three horizontal dots. This section has sub-selections. 

Let me give a quick overview of each of these options.
I should turn this on now!

<<Accounts>>

Show Running Balance: This is an additional column that shows the balance after each transaction. This is very helpful during reconciliation.

<<Accounts>>

Hide cleared checkboxes: This removes the column showing the cleared (green) or uncleared (grey) checkbox.

<<Accounts>>

Export: You can download transactions as a csv file.
I should do each time I log in? You got it!

<<Accounts>>

Reconcile: This is a very important feature. Reconciliation is the process to verify the account balance and transactions in MyBudgetCoach match your bank account.

<<Accounts>>

Link account: This option allows the user to link MyBudgetCoach to their bank to automate adding transactions. However, this functionality is not yet available.
I like storing my data
Expert? I am getting there. Getting the hang of it for sure!

<<Accounts>>

Alright! That completes the overview of the account screen. Are you starting to feel like a MyBudgetCoach expert!?

<<Accounts>>

Please note, any income received, including returns or rebates, should all be entered with a Category as 'Income.'
I have entered the payee.

<<Accounts>>

Please select '+ Add New' and enter a Payee of 'Cell Phone Company.'
I have cleared the $100 transaction.

<<Accounts>>

For the category, please select 'Bills', enter a Payment amount of 100, select Add, and Clear the transaction.

<<Accounts>>

Let's now add a transaction for a credit card payment. Credit Card payments are Transfers and entered as a Deposit.
I agree!

<<Accounts>>

The credit card balance, a red negative number, has now increased by 100.
I am now looking at the available accounts for the transfer

<<Accounts>>

Please select '+ Add New' and for the Payee, select 'Make Transfer' and select the checking account under the 'Transfer To/From' list of accounts.
Got it; Deposits <u>reduce</u> Credit Card balance!

<<Accounts>>

The Category field is now populated with Transfer. Enter 100 in the 'Deposit' field since this is a payment to reduce the credit card balance.
Let me navigate over there...

<<Accounts>>

Let's now jump over to the checking account.
Automatically added!? That's a nice feature.

<<Accounts>>

Since you selected 'Make Transfer' as the Payee in your credit card account, this automatically added a transaction to your checking account as well.

<<Accounts>>

Please take note that the Payment field is populated for the checking account, which reduces the balance. However, the credit card account has the Deposit field populated because an inflow to a negative balance reduces the negative balance.
Thanks! That was a breeze.

<<Accounts>>

KUDOS on creating transactions for both accounts!
Thanks for the insight!

<<Accounts>>

When re-creating a copy of your financial institution transactions and balance in MyBudgetCoach, one of the most important pieces is knowing how your 'Current Balance' is calculated by your bank.
Cleared transactions versus pending transactions, got it!

<<Accounts>>

Some banks calculate the 'Current Balance' including pending transactions. Others calculate the 'Current Balance' excluding pending transactions which means only cleared transactions are included.

Yes; the current balance includes pending transactions 
current_balance_calculation = yes_pending
Yes; the current balance <u>does not</u> include pending transactions <br style="border-color: var(--border-color);">current_balance_calculation = yes_no_pending
No; I am not sure if the current balance included pending transactions or not <br style="border-color: var(--border-color);">current_balance_calculation = no

<<Accounts>>

Do you know how your 'Current Balance' is calculated?
Thanks for pointing out this risk

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for this information. This means that the account balance in MyBudgetCoach may not match your current balance.

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for this information. This means that the account balance in MyBudgetCoach should match your financial institution. This  assumes all cleared transactions in the bank account are cleared in MyBudgetCoach.

<<Accounts>>

But, that's OK! I will explain how you can complete a simple process to gain trust that the number in MyBudgetCoach matches your financial institution. To tailor the guidance for your situation, I will ask a few more questions.

<<Accounts>>

Does your current balance match the amount in your MyBudgetCoach account?

<<Accounts>>

Are there pending transactions?

<<Accounts>>

Excellent! This means your Starting Balance in MyBudgetCoach is correct.
I pulled up calculator.net

<<Accounts>>

Understood. Please pull up a calculator. Time to complete a little math!
I have totaled my pending transactions.

<<Accounts>>

Please first total up your pending transactions. Outflows should be negative numbers and inflows should be positive numbers.

<<Accounts>>

Take that total amount and subtract it from your current bank balance.
Understood; I have completed the calculation to find the new starting balance, excluding pending transactions.

<<Accounts>>

If the total of your pending transactions are negative, you would be adding them, since the subtraction of a negative is a positive, to increase your balance. If your pending transactions were positive, it would reduce your balance.
I have updated the starting balance.

<<Accounts>>

Please enter this new amount into the 'Deposit' field of the transaction with a Category of 'Starting Balance' for your checking account.
I definitely don't want to double count expenses. Thanks!

<<Accounts>>

Now, when you import those pending transactions at a later date, your starting balance will remain in-sync with your bank, versus double counting the pending transactions.
I have made a note of this. Thanks for the tip!

<<Accounts>>

Please remember, you will need to complete this small math exercise each time you reconcile this account if there are any pending transactions.

<<Accounts>>

Does your current balance match the amount in your MyBudgetCoach account that you entered for the Starting Balance?

<<Accounts>>

Excellent! This means your Starting Balance in MyBudgetCoach is correct.
Ask away!
Nope; Let's continue to the Budget!
Hmm...Good point

<<Accounts>>

You may be thinking, what about my credit card balance? Do I need to be concerned with pending transactions?

<<Accounts>>

Understood; Let's work together to research further the Starting Balance amount. Let me ask another question.

<<Accounts>>

Are there pending transactions?
I have updated my starting balance.

<<Accounts>>

Please update the amount in the 'Deposit' field of the transaction with a Category of 'Starting Balance' to match the Current Balance you see in your bank account.
Thanks for verifying my starting balance is correct!
Ok; what is the next step?

<<Accounts>>

Understood; Let's work together to update the Starting Balance amount.
I have updated the starting balance.

<<Accounts>>

Please update the amount in the 'Deposit' field of the transaction with a Category of 'Starting Balance' to match the Current Balance you see in your bank account.

<<Accounts>>

Excellent! This means your Starting Balance in MyBudgetCoach is correct.
Thanks for your help!

<<Accounts>>

I completely understand. This is a question you may have not considered before. Let me ask a few additional questions to learn more about your specific bank.

<<Accounts>>

Please review your online bank account.

Are there any pending transactions?

<<Accounts>>

Does your current balance match the amount in your MyBudgetCoach account that you entered for the Starting Balance?

<<Accounts>>

Excellent! This means your Starting Balance in MyBudgetCoach is correct.

<<Accounts>>

If at any time you reach a point where you would like a one-on-one coaching session with me, please select the link to the left and select a time that works for you. Please note, one-on-one coaching does have an additional hourly fee, in addition to your MyBudgetCoach subscription.
Tell me more
Thanks for the tip!

<<Accounts>>

Select your Budget Name in the top left and select 'Rename budget' to update the name.

<<Accounts>>

Please select Create Local Account. Name your account, and then enter the current balance of your checking account.

<<Accounts>>

Please select + Add account.
I have added my joint checking account

<<Accounts>>

Please select Create Local Account. Name your account, and then enter the current balance of your joint checking account.

<<Accounts>>

Please select + Add account.
Ok; I am logged in

Please select Create Local Account. Name your account, and then enter the current balance of your checking account.

<<Accounts>>

Please select + Add account.
I have added my checking account

Please select Create Local Account. Name your joint account, and then enter the current balance of your joint checking account.

If a user can select Bank account
vs Credit Card this step specifying
the negative may no longer be required.

Please select + Add account and then Create Local Account. Name your account, and then enter the current balance of your credit card.

NOTE: Since a credit card balance represents debt, when you enter the balance, add a leading '-' to make the amount entered negative.

NOTE: Since a credit card balance represents debt, when you enter the balance, add a leading '-' to make the amount entered negative.

NOTE: Since a credit card balance represents debt, when you enter the balance, add a leading '-' to make the amount entered negative.

NOTE: Since a credit card balance represents debt, when you enter the balance, add a leading '-' to make the amount entered negative.
I have added my 2nd credit card account

NOTE: Since a credit card balance represents debt, when you enter the balance, add a leading '-' to make the amount entered negative.
I have added my 3rd credit card account

<<Accounts>>

Please select + Add account and then Create Local Account. Name your account, and then enter the current balance of your credit card.

NOTE: Since a credit card balance represents debt, when you enter the balance, add a leading '-' to make the amount entered negative.
I have added my checking account

<<Accounts>>

Please select Create Local Account. Name your account, and then enter the current balance of your checking account.

<<Accounts>>

Please select + Add account.

<<Accounts>>

Do you have your own
credit card separate from the joint credit cards you have already added?

<<Accounts>>

Understood; For now, we are going to hold off adding account(s) that are owned and managed only by you. The budget we will be establishing is for your joint income and expenses.
Ok; I will reach out if needed

<<Accounts>>

If at a later point you would like to add your own accounts, please schedule a one-on-one session with me and I would be happy to help you add the account and discuss strategies for organizing the budget.
Joint only; got it!

<<Accounts>>

Ok! Thanks for your response.

<<Accounts>>

Great job adding your  accounts! You may be thinking: Let me add a savings account next.
Yup! Good call Coach

<<Accounts>>

Before we move to the next step, let's delete those two hypothetical transactions you added.

<<Accounts>>

Please select each of the two transactions using the box to the left of the date. Then select the link named '2 transactions' to the right of the search bar and choose Delete.
I have cleared the Income transaction

<<Accounts>>

Notice that the Uncleared total is 500.

Please select the grey check mark to make it green to clear the transaction.
That makes sense

<<Accounts>>

The Cleared total now matches the account balance and the Uncleared total was updated to 0.
Hmm...this seems rare, but could happen during reconciliation.

<<Accounts>>

There may be times when you want to add an upcoming transaction, but the transaction hasn't cleared at your bank yet.
Thanks for the tip!

<<Accounts>>

In this case, you could add the transaction but leave the checkmark grey, uncleared, until a later date when the transaction has cleared at your bank.
Let's do this!

<<Accounts>>

Now that we have walked through how to add transactions in your checking account, let's complete a similar exercise for your main credit card account.
Oh; Good call

<<Accounts>>

Before we move to the next step, let's delete those two credit card transactions you added.

<<Accounts>>

Please select each of the two transactions using the box to the left of the date. Then select the link named '2 transactions' to the right of the search bar and choose Delete.

<<Accounts>>

Close account: This is how you close the account you selected to view.
Ok; understood
Please do! I can't wait

<<Accounts>>

Adding individual transactions or using Import are the only ways right now to add transactions. Once the Link Account option is made available, you will be notified.
I added 50 in the payment column
I am logged in to my bank account that I added to MyBudgetCoach.

<<Accounts>>

Please login to your bank account to research your current balance.

<<Accounts>>

For this portion of the account set-up, I will be asking you questions along the way. Your responses will be used to tailor my guidance.
Ask away!
account_structure = more_than_one_cc
Thanks for your help!

<<Accounts>>

You now have a solid financial foundation to build on for your Budget.
account_structure = no_cc
Excellent! Glad I am starting on a solid foundation.

<<Accounts>>

Great work! Correcting your Starting Balance now will save much time later on during future reconciliation processes.
Ask away!
Ok; what is the next step?

<<Accounts>>

Understood; Let's work together to update the Starting Balance amount.
I have updated the starting balance.

<<Accounts>>

Please update the amount in the 'Deposit' field of the transaction with a Category of 'Starting Balance' to match the Current Balance you see in your bank account.

<<Accounts>>

Excellent! This means your Starting Balance in MyBudgetCoach is correct.
Thanks for your help!

<<Accounts>>

Does your bank account, either on the website or the mobile app, have the option to show a 'Running Balance'?

If you aren't sure, try searching in the help section of your bank account website or mobile app for instructions on if there is an option to show the Running Balance.

YES
current_balance_calculation = yes_no_pending

NO
current_balance_calculation = yes_pending

<<Accounts>>

Is your Current Balance in your bank account equal to the running balance for your most recent cleared transaction?

<<Accounts>>

Please locate the running balance for the last cleared transaction. Please exclude any pending transactions.

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for this answer. This means that your Current Balance in your bank account does not take into account pending transactions.
Thanks for verifying my starting balance is correct!
Thanks for walking me through the answer of the initial question!
I have found that amount.

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for this answer. This means that your bank account balance does take into account pending transactions.

<<Accounts>>

Does your Current Balance match the amount in your MyBudgetCoach account that you entered for the Starting Balance?
Understood; Only cleared transactions.

<<Accounts>>

Based on this answer, we need to update your Starting Balance, since it currently includes pending transactions. The MyBudgetCoach Starting Balance should be equal to the bank account balance after the most recent cleared transaction.
Thanks for walking me through the answer of the initial question!
I definitely want to avoid double counting expenses!

<<Accounts>>

Having a Starting Balance that includes pending transactions leads to a situation where you will 'double count' the pending transactions on a future date when you add those transactions to MyBudgetCoach once they have cleared at the bank.
I have updated my starting balance!

<<Accounts>>

Please update the amount in the 'Deposit' field of the transaction with a Category of 'Starting Balance' to the Running Balance shown as of the most recent Cleared transaction.

<<Accounts>>

Great work! Correcting your Starting Balance now will save much time later on during future reconciliation processes.
Excellent! Glad I am starting on a solid foundation.

<<Accounts>>

Does the Running Balance after the most recent cleared transaction match the amount you entered for the Starting Balance in MyBudgetCoach?

<<Accounts>>

Excellent! This means your Starting Balance in MyBudgetCoach is correct.
Thanks for verifying my starting balance is correct!
Understood; thanks for explaining all this!

<<Accounts>>

Understood; This means we need to update your Starting Balance. The MyBudgetCoach Starting Balance should be equal to the Running Balance shown after the most recent cleared transaction.
I have updated my starting balance!

<<Accounts>>

Please update the amount in the 'Deposit' field of the transaction with a Category of 'Starting Balance' to the Running Balance amount shown as of the most recent cleared transaction.

<<Accounts>>

Great work! Correcting your Starting Balance now will save much time later on during future reconciliation processes.
Excellent! Glad I am starting on a solid foundation.
Ok! I will use the link to schedule a one-on-one call if I need additional support.

<<Accounts>>

Thanks for answering the questions.

I don't recommend any adjustments to the Starting Balance right now. If in the future your MyBudgetCoach account balance doesn't match your bank and you would like help, please select the link the 'Zoom with Nick' link to schedule a one-on-one call with me and I would be happy to help research the inconsistency in the balances.

<<Budget>>

In the top left, you will see multiple calendar icons. This option allows you to view multiple months at once (dependent on your browser page zooom level). Once you have used MyBudgetCoach for a few months, this can be a fast way to see a comparison in the amount of an expense compared to the budgeted amount.

<<Budget>>

Once you select the number of months you want to view, notice how the months in the top middle now have a 'purple' box around them. The purple box emphasizes the months you have selected for viewing. Click a different set of months to change the months you are viewing.
That's a nice feature!
Oh, I see that now

<<Budget>>

Below the row of month names are the Budget sections for the months selected. Each section has the month listed at the top.

<<Budget>>

Below the month header are a series of fields to give a summary of the total dollars and how they are allocated across the month.

<<Budget>>

Let's now move from the Account screen, to the Budget screen.
Got it; Accounts first, then Budget!

<<Budget>>

Please keep in mind that what happens in the Accounts is reflected in the numbers shown in the Budget. Each time you log in to MyBudgetCoach, plan on working on the account side first, and then once updated across your accounts, move to the budget.
Let's do this!
That's a nice feature!

<<Budget>>

The first section is the 'To Budget' number. You can select this number and see options for moving the available dollars to a category in the table below.
OK! I am ready for the next section.

<<Budget>>

You have now completed the Budget Screen Summary! Our next step will be the Budget Table Summary.

<<Budget>>

To start, let's walk through each column in the Budget Table.
Ok; I am following along

<<Budget>>

The first column is the Category. These groups and individual categories are how you will organize your expenses. For example, if you paid for groceries at your local grocery store, that expense in the Accounts section would be categorized as 'Food'.
Tell me more...

<<Budget>>

The second column is 'Budgeted.' These fields are used to enter amounts which reduce the overall total from the 'To Budget' amount within the Budget Summary section.

<<Budget>>

When using MyBudgetCoach, you will assign all available dollars to specific categories in advance of spending. This methodology transforms your money management from 'reactive' looking at the end of the month and wondering what happened, to 'proactive' where you are creating a plan for how dollars will be used in advance of spending the money.

<<Budget>>

The third column is 'Spent.' This field holds the total of all transactions from the accounts that are categorized to that specific category. If you have three transactions for groceries that are categorized as 'Food', you can select the amount shown in the 'Spent' column in the 'Food' category row to see those three transactions on the account screen.

<<Budget>>

The last column is 'Balance.' The amount shown is a subtraction of the amounts in the Budgeted and Spent columns.

(Budgeted - Spent) = Balance
Ok; the total across all accounts
Tell me more...

<<Budget>>

Now that we have reviewed the columns of the Budget Table, let me walk through how to edit your Budget Table category groups and categories.
I have selected 'Collapse all'

<<Budget>>

To the right of the Category header are three dots. When you select this a series of options comes up. Select 'Collapse all.'
Categories are part of an overall Category Group. Got it!

<<Budget>>

You now see only rows with a grey shading. These are the 'Category Groups.' Within each Category Group are the Categories.
I have created the Category Group

<<Budget>>

Select the 'Add Group' button to add a new Category Group. Name the new group 'Fixed' and select Enter.
Fixed = Same amount of expense

<<Budget>>

The 'Fixed' Category Group will include Categories that have expenses which are generally the same amount month over month. For example, a rent or mortgage, a car payment, cell phone...
Fixed = Fund first!

<<Budget>>

When analyzing your budget, the 'Fixed' group of expenses can be viewed as necessities and where your money needs to go first. You have to make sure you have money available for your car payment prior the payment date.
I am following along

<<Budget>>

We will now Rename one of the existing Category Groups. Move your cursor to the right of the 'Usual Expenses' Category Group and you should see a small down arrow appear.

<<Budget>>

Select the down arrow and that presents a series of options. Notice this is where you 'Add category', 'Hide', 'Rename', and 'Delete'. Let's select Rename.
I have renamed the Category Group to Flexible

<<Budget>>

Name the Category Group 'Flexible' and select Enter.
Oh! Good idea

<<Budget>>

Since 'Fixed' expenses are a higher priority then 'Flexible', let's move the 'Fixed' Category Group to the top of the Budget Table.
Flexible = Variable amounts

<<Budget>>

Flexible expenses are things required to live: groceries; gas for the car; clothing; but the same amount is not spent each month. These categories are those that you would want to analyze if you are looking to reduce spending resulting in left over income for savings or funding a future months' expenses.
I have moved the Fixed Category Group above the Flexible Category Group

<<Budget>>

To do this, select the Fixed Category Group row and Click and Hold to drag the Category Group up to be above Flexible. This will ensure you always focus on funding upcoming Fixed expenses first, and then fund Flexible.

<<Budget>>

Ok great! Now that we have Fixed and Flexible Category Groups, please navigate back to the main Category header and select the option of 'Expand All' under the three dots menu.
Ok; Great!

<<Budget>>

This now allows you to view the Categories within each of the Category Groups. We will now add and rename categories.
I have added a category

<<Budget>>

Navigate to the right of 'Fixed' to un-hide the down arrow and select 'Add category.'
I have named the category

<<Budget>>

Name this newly created category 'Rent' or 'Mortgage,' whichever is applicable for you and select Enter.
I have renamed Food to Groceries

<<Budget>>

Please move now to the Flexible Category Group. Please re-name 'Food' to 'Groceries' by hovering to the right of 'Food' to reveal the down arrow, similar to the Category Group, to select a series of options, including 'Rename.'
Thanks for the tip! I am ready to set-up my Budget Table.

<<Budget>>

Ok great! You have now successfully started to customize your Budget Table!
Negative = Take Action!

<<Budget>>

If Balance is negative, which can be identified by the red text, that means you have spent more than you budgeted. To address this, you need to add money to the Budgeted amount or shift money from another category with a positive Balance.

<<Budget>>

If Balance is positive, you have dollars left over not yet spent. These dollars could be used to fund an overage in another category.
Oh; I definitely want to avoid that!

<<Budget>>

If you don't have funds to either add to the Budgeted column or shift money from a category with a positive balance, then you are at risk for over spending your bank balance, or adding debt to your credit card balance, depending on which account the transaction came from.
I have added my 2nd credit card account
Thanks for the advice!
Thanks for the advice!
Thanks for the advice!
Thanks for the advice!

cards do you actively use each week?

<<Accounts>>

Good news! Credit Cards don't include pending transactions in the current balance. I have been a coach for multiple years and I haven't seen a single Client with a credit card company including pending transactions in the current balance.
Oh phew! That makes it easy.
If this happens, how do I fix this?

<<Accounts>>

This means, if your MyBudgetCoach credit card account balance doesn't match your current balance when logged in to your credit card account, there is a discrepancy with the amount of transaction(s) or the presence of transaction(s) in MyBudgetCoach but not on your account, or vice versa.
Ok; glad to know you are here if I need help!

<<Accounts>>

There are multiple methods we can explore to address discrepancies like this. If an account doesn't match, please schedule a one-on-one call with me and I would be happy to help. I commit to if I can't resolve it during the call, I will complete additional time, at no charge, after the call to develop a solution. You have my commitment to help you get back on track and trusting your numbers!
Thanks! I am feeling really good about my progress!!

<<Accounts>>

Thank you [[user_first_name]] for your work thus far. KUDOS for the progress you have made!
Please do!

<<Accounts>>

Let me check in to see how you are doing. As a reminder, I will be here and available to pick up where you left off on your schedule.

<<Accounts>>

In my experience as a coach, incorrect account numbers are one of the main reasons users turn away from budgeting software a few weeks in. I am confident you now have a solid foundation to build upon with your Budget to achieve long-term success!

<<Accounts>>

Would you like to
take a break?
Yup; I will pick up with you next time!

<<Accounts>>

I completely understand! Good-bye for now, and when you return, just select 'Next' to continue the set-up process with the Budget. You have completed the account set-up process!

<<Accounts>>

What happens if your MyBudgetCoach account balance doesn't match your current balance when logged in to your account? This could mean there is a discrepancy with the amount of transaction(s) or the presence of transaction(s) in MyBudgetCoach but not on your account, or vice versa.

BUDGET TABLE SET-UP
sign_up_reason = new_budget
Thanks for reminding me!

<<Budget>>

When we first met, I asked you an initial question for what brought you to MyBudgetCoach.
Yup; I now remember

<<Budget>>

You responded with the selection of: "My current budgeting system isn't bringing me closer to my financial wellness goals."
Ask away!

<<Budget>>

Now that I have walked through how to edit your Budget table, let me ask a question for if you want additional support creating your budget Categories.
Please Do!
Nope; I know what Categories I want

<<Budget>>

Would you like me to create a starting list of categories under each of the category groups of Fixed and Flexible?
Tell me more...

<<Budget>>

Good for you! Before you work on creating your budget, I would recommend adding two additional Category Groups: 1) Non-Monthly; 2) Goals.
Interesting idea

<<Budget>>

Non-Monthly can be used for expenses paid on a quarterly, twice a year, or annual basis. For example, Car Maintenance or Gifts for the yearly Holiday Season.

<<Budget>>

As your coach, I recommend you set aside an amount each month to these Categories. Overtime, the amount in your Balance will accumulate and be available for use when the expense does come up.

<<Budget>>

For the Goals Category Group, you could include luxury items/experiences that take time to save for, such as a New Laptop or a Vacation.
That sounds great!

<<Budget>>

The Categories in the Goals Category Group should also have dollars assigned each month. When that vacation comes up, you can leave your home stress free knowing you have a pot of money set aside to reduce stress spending money while on vacation!

<<Budget>>

That completes your account and budget set-up overview. I have enjoyed helping you through this tutorial and I am confident you have built a successful foundation for starting a new chapter in your personal finance journey and you are now a few steps closer toward financial wellness!
I can definitely do that!
I do enjoy a vacation!
I am all ears!

<<Budget>>

A few other organizational recommendations, and then we will wrap-up the tutorial!
I willl add the due date!

<<Budget>>

Consider adding the day of the month your Fixed Categories are due to your Category Name. For example: Rent (1st). Then you can organize the Categories in day order to prioritize the use of your available money based on where you are in the month. Remember, fund the expenses due prior to the next time you receive income.
I will add the expected monthly total of the expense(s) to the category name!

<<Budget>>

Also, consider adding the amount you expect to spend in any one category in the Category Name. For example: Cell Phone - $125 (20th). Adding the amount you expect to spend will help you compare your actual spending to the amount you expect. This is especially helpful for the Categories in your Flexible Category Group.
I hope that isn't me...but budgeting is a process that requires adjustments every month

<<Budget>>

If you are far off from your proposed amount, compared to your actual spent, after your first full month of MyBudgetCoach use, you know you either need to change your spending behavior, or change the proposed amount for your budget.
I would rather know now and not at the end of this month!

<<Budget>>

Adding an amount to each Category Name also creates the ability for you to total up your proposed amounts across your Categories and compare that to your Income. If the total is more than your Income, you know it is highly unlikely you will have savings available at the end of each month.
Oh, great idea!

<<Budget>>

You can also add the total of your Categories to the name of your Category Group. This is a quick way of looking at your overall spending on any one day of the month compared to the total anticipated, without analyzing each Category individually.
A snap-shot of how I am doing in the month would be very helpful!

<<Budget>>

For example, if you are half-way through the month, but have spent 75% of your Flexible total proposed amount, you should analyze further what adjustments need to be made for the second half of the month to either remain within the proposed amount, or find more dollars to increase the Balance available.

<<Budget>>

Finally, make the budget unique by adding some emojis to your Category and Category Group Names! 🎁🎟📱🚗🚑🏡🏨🍔🍟

Make it fun and personalized to you so when you log-in to MyBudgetCoach, you have a connection to your customized budget!
Good to know; Starting Balance validation did have many steps. I could re-use this when I reconcile!

<<Budget>>

You can select 'Reset Avatar' in the menu to the left and navigate back through from the beginning of the tutorial to any section you want to cover again.
Thanks for your direct contact information!

<<Budget>>

However, if while using the system, you have a question that you come across, feel free to send me an email at nick@personalwealthadventures.com. Please identify yourself as a MyBudgetCoach user in the subject line and include your first and last name in the message. I will review the message and if I can, I will provide an answer back via email, free of charge.

<<Budget>>

If after reviewing your inquiry I determine it would be best to have a conversation, I will recommend you schedule a one-hour session with me through the MyBudgetCoach platform.
Ok; so your avatar isn't like other virtual assistants. Thanks for the heads up!

<<Budget>>

Please note, my coach avatar does not accept chat messages at this time. The software will have a chat option at a later date, but for right now, this is not an option.
Thanks for the heads up!

<<Budget>>

To pay for a one-on-one session, I will send you an invoice via the Square platform to your email you provided when you booked the call. I ask that payment is completed prior to the scheduled session.
Bye for now Nick, and thanks for all your help!

<<Budget>>

KUDOS on taking action and completing this tutorial of the MyBudgetCoach software. Contact me if you have any questions in the future and have a great rest of your day!

<<Budget>>

When we first met, I asked you an initial question for what brought you to MyBudgetCoach.
Thanks for reminding me!
Yup; I now remember

<<Budget>>

You responded with the selection of:

"I haven't created a routine budget process and am looking to get started."

<<Budget>><br style="border-color: var(--border-color);"><br style="border-color: var(--border-color);">Just to confirm, would you like me to build a starting budget template for you including Category Groups and Categories?
Show me my new Budget!

<<Budget>>

Ok great!

Let me set that up for you...
Please Do!
Nope; I know what Categories I want

delete_category_group: Investments and Savings

Thanks for the help!

<<Budget>>

Here it is! What do you think? Pretty great right? Please, keep in mind, you will need to review and make it your own, but this is something to get you started.

<<Budget>>

Before you go off and start editing and adding new Categories not captured, which you definitely should do, let me review some details of what I have included.
I cleared the transaction

<<Accounts>>

MyBudgetCoach predicts you want to add another transaction each time you add a new transaction. You are going to add another test transaction shortly. In the future, if you don't need to add another transaction, select Cancel to remove the blank row.
This box is missing?

<<Budget>>

Here is a good question to ask yourself each time you are entering amounts into your Budgeted column for all your categories, essentially giving all of your dollars a job, so that the 'To Budget' purple number = 0.

What do these dollars need to do prior to getting my next paycheck?
I will keep this in mind, as this will help me prioritize the use of my money!
I will have fun with this step!
Thanks for all your help Nick!
Good to know!
account_structure = no_cc
account_structure = 1_and_1 OR more_than_one_cc

<<Budget>>

The last section of your Budget set-up is a walk-through for setting up your Credit Card Account(s).
Yes; is that an issue?

For the credit card account(s) you added, are there any that you don't plan to pay off the full balance at the end of this month?

Please note, by 'full balance' I am referring to the balance you entered when you added the account. This is not the statement balance, which is a balance as of an earlier date.
Thanks for the heads up!

<<Budget>>

Not at all! It does require a few additional steps to make sure MyBudgetCoach works properly for you.
Understood; I am taking notes...

<<Budget>>

If you have more than one credit card account, you will need to complete the following steps on your own. I will walk you through how to complete the first one!

<<Budget>>

Step 1 is to create a Category Group called 'Credit Cards'. Under that Category Group, you would add a Category for each of the credit card account(s) you added.

Let me add this for you as a starting point...
Ok; I will select my credit card account now

<<Budget>>

OK! Step 1 is completed. 

Let's move to Step 2. For this, we will shift from the Budget to the Accounts section and select a credit card account.

create_category_group: Credit Cards
create_category: Credit Cards: Credit Card Account
Please do!
I see that transaction. It has a Category of Starting Balance.

<<Accounts>>

The first transaction should be the transaction that was added when you first added the account. You should see an amount in the 'Payment' column that equals the balance on the day you added the account.

<<Accounts>>

Good eye on the category! Now that we have created the category on the Budget for the Credit Card Account, we are going to change the Category from 'Starting Balance' to 'Credit Card Account.'
move_to: first_transaction
Ok; Let me switch over to the Budget.

<<Accounts>>

Great work! Now, lets go back to the Budget and see what happened with the 'Spent' and 'Balance' columns in the Credit Card Account category.
I have changed the Category

<<Budget>>

Notice how the 'Spent' column is a negative number that equals your balance you entered previously.
That makes sense.

<<Budget>>

Since the 'Budgeted' column is $0.00, the 'Balance' is a negative red number equal to 'Spent.'
Oh! This happened when I changed the category. I got it now!
move_to: spent_column
Ask away!

<<Budget>>

The last step, Step 3, is to complete the actions for how you want MyBudgetCoach to handle the debt associated with the credit card. You have some options, so let me first ask you a question so I can tailor my guidance.
CREDIT CARD SET-UP IN BUDGET
Nope; I can pay the full balance today if I wanted!

<<Budget>>

Good for you! KUDOS on managing your debt. Very few people with a credit card balance have the cash flow to pay it off in full at any time.
I have entered the amount in the Budgeted column

<<Budget>>

Now in this case, because you have the Credit Card Account category with a negative red balance, you would want to enter the amount of the Balance into the 'Budgeted' column. This will update the 'Balance' to be $0 since you would have assigned dollars to account for the negative Spent amount.
I did notice that. Understood!

<<Budget>>

When you completed this, did you notice how the purple number at the top of the Budget Summary went down? It went down because you took a portion of the dollars available to assign to your categories, and you budgeted them into the Credit Card Account category.
I can't wait to get started!

<<Budget>>

You can now budget with confidence the rest of your available dollars to your remaining categories, until your 'To Budget' number is $0.00. In addition, today you can make a credit card payment in-full since you first budgeted your available dollars to your current balance!
Thanks for the compliment! I have worked hard to be in this position.

<<Budget>>

Now in this case, because you are not planning to pay off the current balance in the near future, we need to allow the remaining balance you don't pay off this month, your first month of your Budget, to continue to future months, since your credit card company will continue to have that balance carry over until you pay it off.

<<Budget>>

MyBudgetCoach has a unique feature that is called 'Rollover overspending.' This option allows a user to accumulate negative Balances to future months. If you don't select this option, MyBudgetCoach will automatically take the money from your To Budget amount to cover your negative Balance.

<<Budget>>

This may not be your preference since the money in your bank account needs to pay for other things, than the balance of your credit card, this week. Accordingly, we will have you select the option to 'Rollover overspending' in the Credit Card Account category(ies) where you don't plan to pay off the full credit card balance this month.
That makes sense.
Thanks for the heads up!
I have selected the option. Is it just me, or did a small arrow show up to the right of the amount?

<<Budget>>

Select the negative amount in red text in the Balance column of your Credit Card Account Category. Within the option menu that comes up, select the 'Rollover overspending' option.
Ok; how do I complete this option?
Ok; I understand now the importance of this option!

<<Budget>>

Great catch! That is correct. This arrow pointing to the right is how MyBudgetCoach alerts you to the fact you have rolled over the overspending for future months. This option will stay turned on for all future months, unless you select to 'Remove overspending rollover.'

<<Budget>>

When you get to the end of each month, and you may have categories that have a negative red number in the Balance column, please think carefully prior to selecting the 'Rollover overspending' option. For the credit card category, there is a clear use case.
Good to know! I am thankful for the advice upfront on these difficult topics.

<<Budget>>

That's right! For other categories, especially those with expenses from a bank account, not a credit card, it can be very risky to select because what could happen is your budget no longer matches the reality of your accounts. In that case, MyBudgetCoach is no longer accurate compared to your actual financial accounts.
I see; so don't use that option to cover all overspending.
I need to use dollars from my 'To Budget' available balance to make credit card payments. That makes sense to me!

<<Budget>>

If you wanted to make a payment to your credit card account(s), for example the minimum payment due, or a payment in excess of the minimum payment, you would enter the amount of your future payment into the 'Budgeted' column of the Credit Card Account Category(ies).

<<Budget>>

If you were to enter an amount in the 'Budgeted' column, the amount in the Balance column would reduce since the subtraction of 'Budgeted - Spent' would be the resulting number.
Thanks for the heads up for how to handle credit card interest!

<<Budget>>

To handle interest applied to your credit card account(s), if applicable, you would add a Category called 'Interest' under your Credit Card Group. The interest transactions for each credit card would then be categorized to this category of the budget.
Oh, of course! I am following along

<<Budget>>

Credit Cards can be complex, especially if you have more than one credit card account. I am available for a one-on-one call at your convenience to help answer any questions you may have in your future use of MyBudgetCoach.
I can't wait to get started!

<<Budget>>

Now it is your turn to add any remaining Credit Card Account categories, update the transaction from a Category of 'Starting Balance,' and determine how to account for the credit card balance.
I will keep that in mind!

<<Budget>>

If you select the number in the Balance column, you will see an option for 'Move category.' Once selected, you can enter an amount and then select the category to move that money to. This can be helpful when moving money from an overfunded category to an underfunded category. The available dollars can be used however you would like!
Positive = Money Available!
This helps address the flexibility in my spending!

<<Budget>>

Think of MyBudgetCoach as creating a series of digital envelopes to store your money. Each envelope has a specific purpose and creates intentionality in your cash flow management.
Digital envelopes I can update at any time and customize for my lifestyle. Awesome!
You got it Coach! I always did complete my homework during school!

<<Budget>>

Once these actions are completed, please edit the remainder of your Budget template to include all appropriate Categories for your expenses to match your lifestyle.

<<Budget>>

account_structure = more_than_one_cc AND budget_with_partner = joint_consolidated
account_structure = more_than_one_cc AND (budget_with_partner = just_me OR budget_with_partner = joint_separate)

<<Accounts>>

So far, you have completed steps 1 through 4 of the Account Set-Up stage.  
  1. Renaming Budget
  2. Adding Accounts
  3. Overview of Account screen
  4. Adding a transaction
  5. Verifying Starting Balance
We will now work through the final step, Verifying your Starting Balance.
Last step for Account Set-Up! Let's do this!
Oh right! Let me double check I have it turned on for this account.

<<Accounts>>

As we reviewed earlier, MyBudgetCoach has an option to show 'Running Balance' in your accounts.

<<Accounts>>

A 'Running Balance' is the balance of your account after each transaction has cleared.
That makes sense!

<<Accounts>>

For example, if you have $500 in your bank account, and a $100 Payment is cleared, the 'Running Balance' for that transaction would be $400 ($500 - $100).
I will definitely keep this in mind.

<<Accounts>>

A 'Running Balance' allows you to select any date and compare MyBudgetCoach to your bank account balance. This is especially helpful when using bank account statements to verify the numbers shown in MyBudgetCoach are in-sync.

<<Accounts>>

In addition to using the 'Running Balance' in MyBudgetCoach, it is very helpful to view the 'Running Balance' within your bank account.
Hmm...Let me research if my bank account has that option to show a running balance.

<<Accounts>>

Unfortunately, some online websites and/or mobile apps, for banks don't offer the option of the 'Running Balance.' If your bank doesn't have the option, it can add complexity to reconciling your account if the numbers don't match up.

<<Accounts>>

Now that I have reviewed the importance of a 'Running Balance,' let me ask a few more questions.
I agree!
Ask away!
I am ready to get started!
